summary: Most core requirements appear implemented: domain suffix selector with exact options, paid plugins tab with a large catalog, and a simulated 3-method purchase dialog with per-server ownership persisted via server model + localStorage normalization. However, the diff summary is truncated in key areas, so some acceptance-criteria items cannot be confirmed from the provided evidence (notably installation gating until owned, and the presence of a recharge-style direct-payment UI beyond a simple confirm action).

missing_requirements.requirement: If an owned paid plugin supports installation in the UI, installation is disabled/blocked until owned (and enabled once owned).
missing_requirements.reason: PluginsPage.tsx is truncated before the paid plugins card rendering/installation actions, so itâ€™s not possible to verify that installation is blocked for unowned paid plugins and enabled after purchase.

missing_requirements.requirement: Direct Payment method provides a recharge-style UI (e.g., amount/confirm) and, upon confirmation, marks the plugin as purchased with a success message.
missing_requirements.reason: PaidPluginPurchaseDialog.tsx is truncated within the TabsContent rendering; while direct payment state/handler exists, the actual UI elements (amount input + confirm) for the Direct Payment tab are not visible in the diff summary.
